channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sam Altman sometimes wishes OpenAI were public so haters could short the stock—‘I would love to see them get burned on that’
item.description: Despite reports, Altman said OpenAI has no specific timeline on going public.

item.title: Ferrari to release crypto token to let wealthy fans take part in 499P auction
item.description: The Italian car maker says the 100 top token owners will be able to bid on the luxury car

item.title: Walmart CEO said paying its star managers upwards of $620,000 yearly empowered them to ‘feel like owners’
item.description: From Rolls-Royce to Volkswagen, companies are betting big on pay hikes to fix culture—because money still talks.

item.title: Cybercriminals are stooping to a new low by targeting job seekers when the market is already bad: ‘Where’s the good sheep for the wolf to go attack?’
item.description: DNSFilter found 8,724 malicious domains containing the word “jobs,” with the overwhelming majority (86%) newly registered or observed.

item.title: Donna Jean Godchaux-MacKay, Grateful Dead Singer, Dies at 78
item.description: She helped shape the band’s sound in the 1970s, a decade that took the band to new heights.

item.title: Stock futures climb as investors await Supreme Court showdown on Trump tariffs and shareholder vote on Musk’s $1 trillion pay package
item.description: On Thursday, Tesla shareholders will gather for the company’s annual meeting and will vote on Musk’s $1 trillion compensation package.

item.title: Torre dei Conti Partially Collapses in Rome, Trapping a Worker
item.description: Rescuers were trying to remove the man from the debris at the medieval tower, but said it was a dangerous operation. Another man was seriously injured...

item.title: With Acquisition, Kimberly-Clark Bets That Tylenol Can Weather the Storm
item.description: The consumer products giant reached a $40 billion deal to buy Kenvue, the maker of Tylenol, despite a barrage of unproven claims from President Trump ...

item.title: These Israeli Dissidents Can Show Americans How to Be a Good Citizen of a Bad Country
item.description: And why it matters so much to try.

item.title: A Big Moment for Women in India
item.description: My colleague Mujib Mashal writes about how a huge victory on the cricket ground could change the lives of women and girls.

item.title: Arrests in Louvre Heist Show Power of DNA Databases in Solving Crimes
item.description: France’s trove of DNA profiles has helped solve high-profile crimes and was used to find some of the Louvre suspects, and it is growing. The police ca...

item.title: U.K. Police Investigate Possible Link Between Train Attack and Stabbing of 14-Year-Old
item.description: The police are examining whether the suspect in the stabbing spree on a London-bound train on Saturday was connected to three other incidents involvin...

item.title: Torre dei Conti Partially Collapses in Rome, Trapping a Worker
item.description: Rescuers were trying to remove the man from the debris at the medieval tower, but said it was a dangerous operation. Another man was seriously injured...

item.title: After Hurricane Melissa, a Seaside Town in Jamaica Picks Up the Pieces
item.description: Ninety percent of the homes in Black River, Jamaica, were destroyed by Hurricane Melissa, reflecting the broader devastation and rebuilding facing man...
